{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.12903v1", "title": "Reduced Čech complexes and computing higher direct images under
  toric maps", "summary": "This paper has three main goals : (1) To give an axiomatic formulation of the
construction of "reduced \v{C}ech complexes", complexes using fewer than the
usual number of intersections but still computing cohomology of sheaves; (2) To
give a construction of such a reduced \v{C}ech complex for every semi-proper
toric variety $X$, such that every open used in the complex is torus stable,
and such that the cell complex governing the reduced \v{C}ech complex has
dimension the cohomological dimension of $X$; and (3) to give an algorithm to
compute the higher direct images of line bundles relative to a toric fibration
between smooth proper toric varieties.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG", "published": "2025-04-17T12:48:18Z"}
